Description: A hollow terracotta model of a sword-hilt, with a ribbed grip and a pointed-oval pommel with a knob on top. Modelled on both sides, and complete in itself: there is no blade. Two-piece mould. Micaceous orange-brown Nile silt, with a darker surface.
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Purchased: Greville J. Chester. Acquired in the Fayum. Roman, probably within the first three centuries AD: not unlike a sword-hilt in Feugère 2002: 111, fig. 139. Comparanda: Near: Breccia 1934: no. 454. See handle of a complete model sword, Fjeldhagen 1995: no. 210, dated Roman Imperial period. Not unlike Török 1995: no. 311, dated late Hellenistic or early Roman periods. Bibliog: Fjeldhagen 1995: no. 210.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3295)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
